articles.author: JB, FinOps Product Dept. Director & Core CS Team Lead
articles.description:
New!
Â Â 
Today, we are glad to announce yet a new feature: a brand new Dashboard section that will allow you to easily manage your daily tasks, directly from your Smily account.
Here is a sneak peek at what the new Dashboard looks like:

In the past, managing day to day operations may have been complicated. Tasks such as keeping track of payments, approving pending tentatives and others were time consuming.
Thanks to the Dashboard, you now have access to the following information:
List of pending tentatives: to help you convert them into confirmed bookings, or cancel them to free up the dates in your calendar
List of bookings with missing payments: to help you get all your payments on time and never miss a payment again
List of arrivals of the day: to help you plan the check-in of your guests
List of departures of the day: to help you plan the check-out of your guests
You can find more details in the dedicated manual article, and a video guided tour of the new Dashboard section will soon be added there as well.
We invite you to explore this new Dashboard, and hope it will help you save time and better manage your daily operations. Some improvements will also be made in the future, such as adding performance metrics to help you manage your business more easily.
articles.title: [New feature] Brand new Dashboard section to easily manage your daily tasks from Smily ðŸš€

articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
New!
Â Â 
At BookingSync, we are here to make you Save time and Book more. That's why we are always thrilled to announce more and more features.
This time the new feature concerns the reviews management, you can now manage all your reviews on BookingSync. Yes ! all the reviews posted on the biggest channels : Airbnb, Booking.com plus your direct bookings.
When accessing the Reviews section, you will see 2 different sub-menus:
Guest Reviews: This section will allow you to see the different reviews posted by the guests for each property, the rating plus the message posted by the guest, if you need more detail you can click on the review, a new page will appear with the Review details, the Booking details, the complete guest review message, and the host review if itâ€™s already posted, and you have the possibility to reply to the review message.


Host Reviews: This section will allow you to evaluate your guest and share a detailed rating and a review message.


For each of these section you will be able to filter the reviews by Rating, Rentals and Source.
Please find here the video demo explaining step by step the feature.
We invite you to discover all these new features, and hope it will help you to have a better management of your reviews, save more time, and have a better ranking and visibility on the channels !
Donâ€™t hesitate to contact our customer care if you have any questions.
articles.title: [New feature] Manage all your reviews from your BookingSync Account !

articles.author: Sebastien, Founder & CEO of Smily
articles.description:
New!
Â Â 
You can now simulate your monthly subscription fee based on your projected number of properties and gross booking value.
This is accessible to account owners in the Settings > Billing area.
This subscription fee will be applicable from September 1, 2022.
articles.title: Simulate your monthly subscription fee

articles.description:
Sep  1, 02:46 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.
If required, please re-push any Pricing Settings Standard Fees updates that may have failed during the incident.
Apologies for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your understanding.
Aug 31, 19:24 PDT
Monitoring - The cause has been identified and mitigated; the errors should no longer be thrown.
We are monitoring the situation.
Apologies for any inconvenience caused.
Aug 30, 23:33 PDT
Investigating - We have noticed an elevated rate of 400 Errors on the Pricing Settings endpoint when attempting to update Standard Fees.
We are investigating the issue.
articles.title: 400 Error on Pricing Settings Endpoint When Updating Standard Fees

Resolved - This incident has been resolved. If you come across this issue again, don't hesitate to reach out through the Support Portal.
Aug 22, 16:10 PDT
Monitoring - We have implemented a fix, and are monitoring the results. If you come across this issue, don't hesitate to reach out through the Support Portal.
Aug 22, 15:21 PDT
Investigating - We are investigating an issue that is preventing some images and listings from loading on Airbnb's homepage on airbnb.com, as well as the ability for Hosts to complete some listings. We will post more updates as soon as we have it.

articles.description:
Aug 18, 00:00 PDT
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Jul 19, 00:00 PDT
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Jul 18, 15:13 PDT
Scheduled - We are currently rolling out improvements to the backend of our Set Listing endpoint for amenities. This will be done in phases over the course of the next month. 
Please subscribe for deployment updates. We don't expect any change in behavior, but if you come across any issues, please submit an API support request through your Partner Support Portal and link this post.
articles.title: Listing Amenities Improvements

articles.description:
Aug 14, 09:00 PDT
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Jul 15, 09:00 PDT
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Jul 14, 16:01 PDT
Scheduled - Starting on August 15, 2022, the API will respond with `400 validation` errors all requests that violate our content validation policies. This enforcement affects the entire listing description and the instant book welcome message.
Please refer to the Content Validation Enforcement changelog for additional details. Link: https://developer.airbnb.com/changelog/new-content-validation-enforcement
articles.title: Enforcing Content Validation Policies

articles.description:
Sep  6, 16:34 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has confirmed full resolution of the issue with networking in our LON1 region. From 12:57 - 15:33 UTC, a subset of Droplet-based services in LON1 experienced network connectivity issues. All services are now operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.
Sep  6, 15:14 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team was able to take action to mitigate the issue with network connectivity in our LON1 region. At this time, users should be seeing restoration of network connectivity to and from Droplet-based resources in LON1. We are monitoring the situation and will post an update as soon as we confirm the issue is fully resolved.
Sep  6, 13:42 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is investigating reports of connectivity issues in our LON1 region. At this time, users may see timeouts and/or errors with connectivity to and from Droplet-based resources in LON1, including Droplets, Managed Databases, and Kubernetes clusters. We will post an update with further information as soon as possible.
articles.title: Networking in LON1

articles.description:
Sep  2, 09:13 UTC
Resolved - Our engineering team has confirmed that the issues affecting access to the Cloud Control Panel have been fully resolved. We appreciate your patience throughout the process and if you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team for further review.
Sep  2, 08:42 UTC
Monitoring - Our engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue withÂ accessing our Cloud Control Panel and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.
Sep  2, 06:36 UTC
Identified - Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue with accessing the Cloud Control Panel and is actively working on a fix. During this time, users in India might face issues with receiving the authorization code to login to the Cloud Control Panel. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available
Sep  2, 05:19 UTC
Investigating - Beginning 04:00 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating an issue with accessing our Cloud Control Panel. During this time, users may experience intermittent errors while trying to login and receive authorization codes to the phone. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.
articles.title: Cloud Control Panel

articles.description:
Sep  1, 19:09 UTC
Resolved - Our engineering team has confirmed that the issues affecting access to the Cloud Control Panel have been fully resolved. We appreciate your patience throughout the process and if you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team for further review.
Sep  1, 17:40 UTC
Monitoring - Our engineering team has completed the rollback and we can confirm that the Cloud Control Panel is now accessible. We are continuing to monitor the situation for stability and will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved. Thank you for your patience.
Sep  1, 17:10 UTC
Identified - Our engineering team has identified an issue with accessing our Cloud Control Panel. During this time, users may experience intermittent errors while trying to login or interact with the Cloud Control Panel. Our team has initiated a rollback to mitigate the issue and we will post an update as soon as possible. We apologize for the inconvenience.
articles.title: Cloud Control Panel

articles.description:
Aug 26, 20:30 UTC
Resolved - Beginning 14:21 UTC, App Platform deployments in all regions were degraded. Users may have experienced up to 90 minutes of delay in Apps deploying, seeing "Deploy pending" messages in the control panel. Existing Apps were not impacted and remained online. As of 16:05 UTC, our team has fully resolved this issue and all stuck deployments were pushed through. No action is required from users. If you continue to experience any issues, please open a support ticket from within your account.
articles.title: App Platform Deployments

articles.description:
Aug 25, 20:04 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has resolved the issue with Block Storage Volumes. All the operations including creation, deletion, and listing should now be succeeding. We appreciate your patience throughout the process and if you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team for further review.
Aug 25, 18:59 UTC
Monitoring - Our engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with Block Storage Volumes. We are currently monitoring the results and will post an update as soon as the matter is resolved completely.
Aug 25, 17:35 UTC
Investigating - Our engineering team is investigating an issue with Block Storage Volumes. During this time users may experience issues while creating, listing, and deleting the Block Storage Volumes in all regions. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.
articles.title: Block Storage Volumes

articles.description:
Aug 23, 02:54 UTC
Resolved - Our engineering team has confirmed full resolution of the issue with the Cloud Control Panel, API, and Event Processing, and all services should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.
Aug 23, 02:20 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team identified an issue impacting the Cloud Control Panel, API, and event processing in all regions. From 2:01 - 2:12 UTC, users may have experienced high error rates with issuing event and API requests and been unable to load the Control Panel. A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the situation. We will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.
articles.title: Cloud Control Panel, API, Event Processing

articles.description:
Aug 23, 00:36 UTC
Resolved - Our engineering team has resolved the issue with Managed Database Clusters. All database systems should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.
Aug 22, 23:58 UTC
Monitoring - Our engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with Managed Database Clusters and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.
Aug 22, 23:02 UTC
Investigating - Our engineering team is investigating an issue with Managed Database Clusters. At this time, users will be unable to list or modify clusters in the control panel and will not be able to check the status of a cluster via monitoring. This should not impact the functionality of a currently running database cluster. 
We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.
articles.title: Managed Database Clusters.

articles.description:
Aug 19, 14:28 UTC
Resolved - Between 9:50 - 13:00 UTC, users were unable to load the Managed Kubernetes page in the Cloud Panel. Our Engineering team has fully resolved this issue and all services are functioning correctly. 
If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologise for any inconvenience.
Aug 19, 13:16 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with functionality of the Managed Kubernetes page in the Cloud Panel and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.
Aug 19, 13:05 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with the functionality of the Managed Kubernetes page in the Cloud Panel. During this time, users will experience a white page while accessing the Kubernetes dashboard. Cluster functionality remains unaffected and users may utilize the API to manage their clusters. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.
articles.title: Managed Kubernetes Dashboard

articles.description:
Aug 16, 18:42 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has confirmed resolution of the issue with the Cloud Control Panel and DigitalOcean sites. Our team also confirmed API requests were impacted as a result of this incident and users may have seen API failures between 17:53 - 18:03 UTC. All services should now be operating normally. 
If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.
Aug 16, 18:11 UTC
Monitoring - As of 17:53 UTC, our Engineering team identified an issue with the Cloud Control Panel and some other DigitalOcean webpages, such as marketplace.digitalocean.com. Users were unable to reach cloud.digitalocean.com and may have seen a maintenance page, as well as have been unable to reach other DigitalOcean sites, like the Marketplace. 
Our team deployed a fix at 18:03 UTC and are now monitoring the situation. We will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved. We apologize for any inconvenience.
articles.title: Cloud Control Panel and WWW sites

articles.description:
Aug 12, 01:34 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has completed work to identify remaining emails impacted by this incident. At this time, there remains a small subset of emails not being delivered to users, including some billing emails like finalized invoices and billing threshold alerts, App Platform alerts, and DBaaS alerts. Multiple teams are working together to ensure that these emails are able to be sent out correctly and that work will continue. 
At this time, we are going to resolve the incident due to critical email functionality being restored. If you have any concerns about the remaining emails impacted, or any questions about this incident, please open a support ticket from within your account. 
Thank you for your patience throughout this process and we apologize for the extenâ€¦
articles.title: Email Notifications

articles.description:
Aug 11, 15:15 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has observed mitigated impact for this issue, due to actions taken upstream. Users should no longer experience any network latency/packet loss on Droplets and Droplet-based services from SGP to the EU region. App Platform health checks should now pass as expected. 
We apologize for the inconvenience. If you're still experiencing any issues, please open a support ticket.
Aug 11, 14:26 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is aware of an upstream issue impacting network connectivity from SGP to the EU region. During this time, users may experience network latency/packet loss on Droplets and Droplet-based services from SGP to the EU region. 
We are also seeing App Platform health checks fail as a result of this issue.
Our Engineering team is investigating any possible mitigations to work around this upstream issue. We will provide an update as soon as further information is available.
articles.title: Transit Network connectivity in SGP1 region

articles.description:
Aug 10, 06:14 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this maintenance, please send us a ticket from your Cloud support page.
Aug 10, 04:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Aug 10, 03:59 UTC
Scheduled - Start: 2022-08-10 04:00 UTC
End: 2022-08-10 08:00 UTC 
During the above window, we will be performing maintenance in our TOR1 region as part of network upgrades.
Expected Impact:
During this period, inbound and outbound traffic between TOR1 and the rest of the DO network may experience a couple of brief (5-10 second) interruptions as traffic is isolated from each TOR1 core switch prior to being upgraded. We will endeavor to keep any such impact to a minimum.
If you have any questions or concerns regarding this maintenance, please send us a ticket from your Cloud support page.
articles.title: Networking Maintenance in TOR1

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-06 22:30 and ended at 2022-09-07 00:18 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

The problem with Google Chat has been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.

Affected products: Google Chat
articles.title: RESOLVED: We are continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide an update by Sep 7, 2022, 12:00 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem.

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-06 22:30 and ended at 2022-09-07 00:18 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Our team is continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide an update by Sep 7, 2022, 2:00 AM UTC with more information about this problem. Thank you for your patience.

All Google Chat users will no longer have Chat Smart Reply features. The regular Chat functionality is not affected.

Affected products: Google Chat

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-06 07:00 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

We expect to resolve the problem affecting a significant subset of users of Google Calendar at Sep 7, 2022, 1:00 PM UTC. Please note that this time frame is an estimate and may change.

We will provide more information by Wednesday, 2022-09-07 06:15 US/Pacific.

Customers might see that the events in the calendar might not be in the right time for those who have events saved in the Chilean timezone.

Users may follow guidelines from: https://blog.google/intl/es-419/actualizaciones-de-producto/android-chrome-play/chile-preparandonos-para-la-mejor-experiencia-frente-al-cambio-de-hora/

Affected products: Google Calendar
articles.title: UPDATE: We're aware of a problem with Google Calendar affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Sep 6, 2022, 7:07 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change.
